name: 楊侑倫
objective: This course introduces material's elastic and plastic response under static and dynamic loads. The content of this course includes Material science, heat treatment, dislocation plasticity, and strengthening mechanisms of materials. Material's failure mechanisms including yielding, fracture, fatigue, creep, and others will also be discussed.
schedule:
Introduction (week 1)
1. Structure and Deformation in Materials (week 2-3)
2. A Survey of Engineering Materials (week 4-5)
3. Mechanical Testing methods (week 6-7)
-------Mid-term report------- (week 8)
4. Stress-strain relationships (week  9-11)
5. Fracture mechanics (week 12-13)
6. Theory of plasticity (week 14-16)
-------Final report------- (week 17)
scorePolicy:
Homework and attendance 30%
mid term exam 35%
final report 35%
materials: Mechanical Behavior of Materials 5/E by Norman E. Dowling
